main_topic.author: CchristoC
main_topic.title: Scoring Questions
main_topic.content:
How does this Err, 1st, 3rd things in the [] besides the name in the scoring results work?

On one of my agents,  Err gives -184 and -95

This one [3rd] can give -118, then another [Err] gives -118

While in this match it can give just -5

And what do they mean?

Agent log for the Err one:

comments.author: Araik Tamazian
comments.content: "Err" means that your code threw an exception during the game.
comments.date: Posted a month ago  ·  520th in this Competition

comments.author: Krens
comments.content: I also encountered the same Err, have you solved it?
comments.date: Posted 24 days ago  ·  56th in this Competition

reply.author: CchristoCTopic Author
reply.content: Check your agent logs, if its not timeout, and the agent gets an Err midgame (can do some successful turns beforehand) then its probably an out of memory issue. (If your teammate's agent give lengthy prompts then its probably true, either shorten your own prompt or truncate their prompt if too long, or other solutions like using smaller models)
reply.date: Posted 24 days ago  ·  107th in this Competition

reply.author: Krens
reply.content: Thank you, I think it should be an out of memory issue. Because my Err agent is always the answerer, and I added historical information to the prompts, which are too long.
reply.date: Posted 24 days ago  ·  56th in this Competition

comments.author: CchristoCTopic Author
comments.content: Turns out 3rd means the losing group
comments.date: Posted a month ago  ·  107th in this Competition
